intro: Hedypnois cretica subsp. tubaeformis, commonly known as the tubular hedypnois, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its tubular flowers are adapted for pollination by insects, particularly bees. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated, tubular shape, which gives it its common name.
